text_description.0: Volvariella bombycina, Straw mushroom. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antioxidant, anti-cancer. 5-20cm white bell-shaped, white free gills, stem: white, volva, Brownish pink spores. Habitat: Hardwood, late spring to fall.
text_description.1: Schizophyllum commune, Common Porecrust. Edible mushroom. Benefits: anti-cancer, antitumor, antioxidant. 1-5cm whitish fan-shaped, whitish split gills, White spores. Habitat: Hardwood, year-round.
text_description.2: Lentinula edodes, Shiitake mushroom. Edible mushroom. Benefits: immune support, anti-cancer, antiviral. 5-15cm tan to brown umbrella-shaped, whitish adnexed gills, stem: whitish to cream, White spores. Habitat: Hardwood, warm and moist forests.
text_description.3: Auricularia auricula-judae, Black wood ear. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antibacterial, antitumor, antioxidant. up to 9cm purplish-brown ear-shaped, absent, White spores. Habitat: Hardwood, year-round.
text_description.4: Auricularia polytricha, Cloud ear fungus. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antioxidant, antimicrobial. dark yellowish-brown, hairy, absent, stem: absent or very short. Habitat: Wood, moist forests.
text_description.5: Agaricus bisporus, Button mushroom. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antioxidant, immune support, anti-inflammatory. 2.5-14cm white or brown convex, pink to black free gills, stem: white, ring, Dark brown spores. Habitat: Grasslands, after rain.
text_description.6: Pleurotus pulmonarius, Indian Oyster. Edible mushroom. Benefits: anti-inflammatory, antitumor, antioxidant. 3-10cm whitish fan-shaped, whitish decurrent gills, stem: whitish, eccentric or lateral, White to gray or lilac spores. Habitat: Hardwood, late spring through September.
text_description.7: Ganoderma lucidum, Reishi. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, immune support. 3-20cm red-brown fan-shaped, glossy, white pores, stem: chestnut or dark brown, lateral, Brown spores. Habitat: Hardwood, late summer to early autumn.
text_description.8: Tylopilus felleus, bitter bolete. Edible mushroom. 5-13cm brown convex, pink pores, stem: whitish to pale brownish, reticulate, Brownish pink spores. Habitat: Conifer.
text_description.9: Pleurotus ostreatus, oyster mushroom. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antioxidant, heart health, immune support. 5-18cm white to blue-gray convex, white decurrent gills, stem: white, short or absent, White to faintly yellowish or lilac spores. Habitat: Hardwood.
text_description.10: Boletus edulis, cep. Edible mushroom. 5-20cm yellowish-brown convex, absent, stem: white to light brown, bulbous, Olive-brown spores. Habitat: Conifer, oak, June to October.
text_description.11: Tremella fuciformis, snow fungus. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antioxidant, immune support, heart health. up to 7.5cm whitish frond-like, absent. Habitat: Hardwood, after heavy rains.
text_description.12: Hericium erinaceus, lion's mane. Edible mushroom. Benefits: immune support, antibacterial, anti-inflammatory. 8-25cm white clump of soft spines, absent, White spores. Habitat: Wood, late summer/fall.
text_description.13: Macrolepiota Albuminosa, Termite Mushroom. Edible mushroom. Benefits: immune support, heart health, anti-inflammatory. 3-7cm white to light yellow, absent, stem: ivory white, thick. Habitat: Termite nests, May-October.
text_description.14: Cantharellus cibarius, golden chanterelle. Edible mushroom. up to 10cm yellow funnel-shaped, yellow decurrent ridges, stem: thick, decurrent, Pale yellow to creamy white spores. Habitat: Soil, summer and autumn.
text_description.15: Hypsizygus tessellatus, White beech mushroom. Edible mushroom. 4-8cm whitish convex, whitish attached gills, stem: whitish, White to buff spores. Habitat: Wood, fall.
text_description.16: Pleurotus eryngii, King Trumpet Mushroom. Edible mushroom. Benefits: antioxidant, immune support, heart health. 1-8cm tan to brown convex, white to light brown decurrent gills, stem: white to light brown, White spores. Habitat: Hardwood, late summer to early fall.
text_description.17: Amanita verna, Fool's Mushroom. Poisonous mushroom. Contains alpha-amanitin, phallotoxins causing liver failure, kidney failure, diarrhea. 5-10cm white egg-shaped, white free gills, stem: white, volva, ring, White spores. Habitat: Woodlands, springtime.
text_description.18: Amanita virosa, Death Angel. Poisonous mushroom. Contains alpha-amanitin causing liver failure, vomiting, diarrhea, death. 2.5-12cm white bell-shaped, white free gills, stem: white, volva, ring, White spores. Habitat: Woodlands, summer to autumn.
text_description.19: Amanita phalloides, Death Cap. Poisonous mushroom. Contains amatoxins causing liver failure, vomiting, diarrhea, death. 4-16cm greenish-yellow round, white free gills, stem: white, volva, ring, White spores. Habitat: Hardwood, summer to mid-winter.
text_description.20: Chlorophyllum molybdites, False Parasol. Poisonous mushroom. Causes gastrointestinal, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea. 10-35cm white to brownish convex, white to grayish-green free gills, stem: white to brown, ring, Dull grayish-green spores. Habitat: Lawns, summer to fall.
text_description.21: Lepiota brunneoincarnata, Deadly Dapperling. Poisonous mushroom. Contains alpha-amanitin causing liver damage, nausea, vomiting, death. 2.5-6cm pinkish-brown convex, creamy white free gills, stem: creamy white with pink flush, ring, White spores. Habitat: Grassy areas, July to November.
text_description.22: Amanita muscaria, Fly Agaric. Poisonous mushroom. Contains ibotenic acid, muscimol, muscarine causing hallucination, vomiting, nausea, death. 7-20cm red to orange hemispherical with white flakes, white free gills, stem: white, volva, ring, bulbous, White spores. Habitat: Forests, July to November.
text_description.23: Entoloma sinuatum, Livid Pinkgill. Poisonous mushroom. Causes gastrointestinal, diarrhea, vomiting, death. 6-20cm ivory white convex, yellowish white to pinkish sinuate gills, stem: ivory white, bulbous, Pink spores. Habitat: Woodlands, late summer to autumn.
text_description.24: Panaeolus papilionaceus, bell-capped mottlegill. Poisonous mushroom. Causes hallucination. 1.5-4.0cm gray-brown bell-shaped, pale grey to blackish adnate gills, stem: gray-brown, slender, hollow, Black spores. Habitat: Dung.
text_description.25: Inocybe rimosa, straw-colored fiber head. Poisonous mushroom. Contains muscarine causing poisoning. 2-8cm straw yellow conical, whitish to brownish attached gills, stem: whitish or pale yellowish, Brown spores. Habitat: Hardwoods or conifers, summer and fall.
text_description.26: Coprinopsis atramentaria, Ink cap. Poisonous mushroom. Contains coprine causing nausea, vomiting. 3-10cm gray to gray-brown oval, white to black gills, melting, stem: white, hollow, Black spores. Habitat: Wood, urban areas, spring to autumn.
text_description.27: Psilocybe semilanceata, liberty cap. Poisonous mushroom. Contains psilocybin, psilocin causing hallucination. 0.5-2cm cream-colored, pimple on top, olive-gray to purple-black gills, stem: cream-colored, slender, fibrous, Very dark purple-brown spores. Habitat: Meadows and pastures.
text_description.28: Amanita pantherina, Panther cap. Poisonous mushroom. Contains muscimol, ibotenic acid causing hallucination, confusion, death. 3-18cm brown to tan convex with white warts, white free gills, stem: white, ring, swollen base, White spores. Habitat: Forests, late summer and autumn.
text_description.29: Galerina marginata, funeral bell. Poisonous mushroom. Contains amatoxins causing liver failure, kidney failure, death, vomiting. 1.5-5cm honey-yellow to cinnamon-brown convex, yellowish to rusty brown attached gills, stem: whitish to brownish, ring, Telltale rusty brown spores. Habitat: Wood, year-round.
text_description.30: Pholiotina rugosa, Common Conecap Mushroom. Poisonous mushroom. Contains amatoxins causing liver failure, death. 1-2cm orangish-brown conic, whitish to brownish attached gills, stem: brownish, ring, Yellow-brown spores. Habitat: Woods, urban landscaping, spring and summer.
text_description.31: Scleroderma citrinum, Common Earth Ball. Poisonous mushroom. 4-12cm dirty-yellow to ochre-brown, warty scales, absent. Habitat: Woods, heathland, autumn to winter.
text_description.32: Gyromitra esculenta, Brain mushroom. Poisonous mushroom. Contains gyromitrin causing liver damage, nausea, death. 3-12cm reddish-brown brain-like, absent, stem: pale yellowish-tan, Yellowish buff spores. Habitat: Conifers, spring.
